resources.string:
There are two types of Vikings in this world, Attackers and Defenders. 

\The Attacker's goal is to capture the king. 

\The Defender's goal is to help the king escape.
Attackers have the first move. Afterwards, players take turns. \n\n\During your turn, you can move your piece: up, down, left or right.
All pieces except for the king are captured if flanked by two enemy pieces, or between a restricted square. A piece is only captured if the trap is closed by the aggressor’s move.
Only the king can occupy the restricted squares. Restricted squares are hostile, meaning they can replace one of the two pieces taking part in a capture.
If the king escapes to any corner square, the defenders win.

Attackers have several ways to win: 

\1. Surround the king 

\2. Surround ALL remaining defenders

There are a few other ways to end the game: 

\1. If you can no longer move your pieces, you lose the game. 

\2. If you can’t end the game or there are X repetitions, it is a draw.
